page.title: 05Road Traffic in Chard
page.content: Road traffic is generally light compared with major towns but Chard suffers from periodic congestion due to the seasonal influx of{tourists during the summer months . Cars and caravans leaving the{M5}and making for the{W.Dorset and E.Devon resorts cause major jams where the {A358}crosses the{A30 . Attempts to solve this condition have led to the designation of relief roads, notably Crowshute link to the N.W. This allows traffic to pass West from the{A358}to the{A30}with minimum delay. However,attempts to route traffic from{A30}to{A358}North of Chard have run into opposition from residents of roads such as Helliers Rd which has turned from a quiet cul de sac into a busy thoroughfare in less than 15 years.
